result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Joseph Knowles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Joseph Knowles is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Joseph Knowles was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Anthony Joseph Knowles was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anthony Joseph Knowles in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2 and Ct. 3, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 dismissed, Domestic Abuse Enhancers dismissed,  Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 2, 30 days jail w/Huber, $443.00 costs Ct. 3, 10 days jail w/Huber, concurrent, $443.00 costs, costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan, Jail start date 4/1/15 at 7:00 P.M., 3 days sentence credit
